history.content:
Next semester, a new course called Data-X: A Course on Data, Systems and Signals is scheduled as IEOR 190D. Will this be allowed as an upper division technical elective choice for L&S CS majors (and EECS majors, in case anyone else was interested)?

Currently, all of the IEOR 190 series is not under the list of approved non-computer science technical electives; however, this course in particular is far more technical in nature than any of the other IEOR 190 classes, requires a working knowledge of Python and statistics/probability as a prerequisite for the class, and teaches a lot of technical topics. According to the class description:

"Computer science tools for this course include Python with NumPy, SciPy, pandas, SQL, NLTK, and TensorFlow. Math concepts include filters, prediction, classification, transforms, Bayesian, maximum likelihood, Markov state space, network graphs, and an introduction to deep learning.  The tools will be presented in applications common to data flow organization of Collect, Combine, Store, Use, Analyze, and Visualize."
history.subject: IEOR 190D (Data-X: A Course on Data, Systems and Signals) as tech. elective
